thread.title: All 43 Cubs game-day giveaways in the 2017 season, ranked
thread.title_full: All 43 Cubs game-day giveaways in the 2017 season, ranked

author: Tim Bannon
title: All 43 Cubs game-day giveaways in the 2017 season, ranked
text:
All 43 Cubs game-day giveaways in the 2017 season, ranked Caption Scenes from Monday's Cubs spring training workout 
Scenes from the Cubs' spring training workout in Mesa, Ariz., on Feb. 20, 2017. (John J. Kim/Chicago Tribune) 
Scenes from the Cubs' spring training workout in Mesa, Ariz., on Feb. 20, 2017. (John J. Kim/Chicago Tribune) Caption Scenes from Monday's Cubs spring training workout 
Scenes from the Cubs' spring training workout in Mesa, Ariz., on Feb. 20, 2017. (John J. Kim/Chicago Tribune) 
Scenes from the Cubs' spring training workout in Mesa, Ariz., on Feb. 20, 2017. (John J. Kim/Chicago Tribune) Caption Cubs' Jason Heyward takes batting practice 
Cubs right fielder Jason Heyward takes batting practice on Monday, Feb. 20, 2017, in Mesa, Ariz. (Mark Gonzales/Chicago Tribune) 
Cubs right fielder Jason Heyward takes batting practice on Monday, Feb. 20, 2017, in Mesa, Ariz. (Mark Gonzales/Chicago Tribune) Caption Pitcher Brett Anderson on adjusting to life with the Cubs 
Cubs pitcher Brett Anderson discusses how he has adjusted to joining the team after a throwing session on Monday, Feb. 20, 2017. (Mark Gonzales/Chicago Tribune) 
Cubs pitcher Brett Anderson discusses how he has adjusted to joining the team after a throwing session on Monday, Feb. 20, 2017. (Mark Gonzales/Chicago Tribune) Caption Joe Maddon on Tim Buss, nuns and getting to know Eloy Jimenez 
Cubs manager Joe Maddon reacts to strength and conditioning coordinator Tim Buss' attire during Monday's warmups and discusses having nuns at spring training and getting to know top prospect Eloy Jimenez on Monday, Feb. 20, 2017. (Mark Gonzales/Chicago Tribune) 
Cubs manager Joe Maddon reacts to strength and conditioning coordinator Tim Buss' attire during Monday's warmups and discusses having nuns at spring training and getting to know top prospect Eloy Jimenez on Monday, Feb. 20, 2017. (Mark Gonzales/Chicago Tribune) Caption Tim Buss, dressed for the occasion, leads Cubs' warmups 
Cubs strength and conditioning coordinator Tim Buss leads warmups in a top hat and sports coat on Monday, Feb. 20, 2017. (Mark Gonzales/Chicago Tribune) 
Cubs strength and conditioning coordinator Tim Buss leads warmups in a top hat and sports coat on Monday, Feb. 20, 2017. (Mark Gonzales/Chicago Tribune) Tim Bannon expect stiff competition in their quest to repeat as champs, Cubs fans should expect stiffer competition to get what is arguably its best lineup of game-day giveaways, which was announced Tuesday. To help you prioritize, we rank all 43.
1. Final out bobblehead, May 20. Only 10,000 fans will get it, so you might want to bring your tent and get there the night before. 
2. Parade confetti globe, June 20. No word on whether they're using the actual parade confetti. (10,000 fans) 
3. Replica championship banner, April 12. The key here is they're giving away 30,000. Most giveaways are only 10,000. 4. Replica World Series trophy, April 15. Be careful, these could be sharp. (10,000 fans) 
5. Anthony Rizzo emoji cap, Aug. 31. Will it include his naturally curly hair? (10,000 fans) 
6. 1908 Cubs replica throwback jersey, June 7. Big block "C" around little bear holding bat. Classic. (10,000 fans) 
7. Replica 2016 NL champions pennant, May 21. (10,000 fans) 
8. Cubs floppy hat, June 6. A Wrigley Field classic. (10,000 fans) 
Photos as the Cubs practice at spring training in Mesa, Ariz. 
9. "World Series MVP" bobblehead, June 8. Here's to you, Ben Zobrist. (10,000 fans) 
10. "Starting Aces" bobblehead, Aug. 17. Hmmmm. Who could that be? (10,000 fans) 
11. Replica Anthony Rizzo Platinum and Gold Glove trophy. June 21. (10,000 fans) 
12. Cubs ice mold, Aug. 1. (10,000 fans) 
13. Cubs beach towel, June 3. (10,000 fans) 
14. Wrigley Field wall mini chalkboard, June 4. (5,000 children) 15. Wrigley Field video board light, June 5. (10,000 fans) 
16. Youth championship wall flag, June 11. (5,000 children) 
17. "Turning Two" bobblehead, July 5. (10,000 fans) 18. Cubs magnet schedule, April 10. (10,000 fans) 
19. Cubs magnet schedule, April 14. (10,000 fans) 
20. Cubs projection night light, July 9. (5,000 children) 
21. Cubs fedora, Aug. 2. (10,000 fans) 
22. Fergie Jenkins retired No. 31 flag, Aug. 14. (10,000 fans) 23. Silver Slugger Award canvas print, May 24. (10,000 fans) 
24. Cubs reusable tote bag, June 19. (20,000 fans) 
25. Cubs T-shirt, May 5. (5,000 adults, bleachers only) 26. Cubs Country cap, June 9. (5,000 adults, bleachers only) 27. Cubs waist pack. July 7. (5,000 adults, bleachers only) 28. Cubs sunglasses. July 21. (5,000 adults, bleachers only) 29. Cubs tank top. Aug. 18. (5,000 adults, bleachers only) 
30. Cubs printed bill cap. Sept. 1. (5,000 adults, bleachers only) 
31. Cubs "Pink Out" T-shirt. May 7. (5,000 fans, bleachers only) 
32. Clark the Cub pocket T-shirt. July 23. (5,000 children) 33. Clark the Cub bank. Aug. 20. (5,000 children) 34. Commemorative trading card pack. Aug. 5. (10,000 fans) 35. Cubs youth baseball tote bag. Aug. 6. (10,000 fans) 36. Player figure. Aug. 15. (10,000 fans) 
37. Cubs lunch bag. Aug. 16. (10,000 fans) 
38. Cubs T-shirt. Aug. 3. (10,000 fans) 
39. Cubs athletic cap. Sept. 9. (10,000 fans) 
40. Cubs knit beanie. Sept. 30. (10,000 fans) 
41. Cubs premium tote bag. Sept. 15. (10,000 fans) 
42. Cubs decals. May 6. (10,000 fans) 
43. Cubs "Camo Item." July 4. Could they be more specific? (10,000 fans)
